Package com.stratic.tpl

Class FactoryLoader

java.lang.Object
com.stratic.tpl.FactoryLoader
public class FactoryLoader extends Object
The factory Loader is the templating framework entry point. It's an engine able to locate templates source code and build corresponding template's factories. It act for a factory, like a Java class loader act for a class.

The default implementation looks for templates definitions in current classpath. By extending this class, more specific implementations can load templates from any source (from a database, for example).

Like class loaders, factory loaders can be chained together to form a cascading delegation system. If a resource is not resolved at a given level, then, the resolution is delegated to the parent level.

  • Method Details

    • getDefault

      public static final FactoryLoader getDefault()
      Get the default factory loader. This default loader locate templates as system resources using the current classpath.
      Returns:
      The default factory loader.

    • getDefault

      public static final FactoryLoader getDefault(Charset charset)
      Get the default factory loader for a given character set. This default loader locate templates as system resources using the current classpath.
      Parameters:
      charset - The character set to be used by the factory loader.
      Returns:
      A default factory loader using the given character set.

    • getDefault

      Get a default factory loader that uses a given class loader. This default loader locate templates as system resources using the given classpath.
      Parameters:
      classLoader - Class loader where to look for resources.
      Returns:

    • getDefault

      Parameters:
      classLoader - Class loader where to look for resources.
      charset - The character set to be used by the factory loader.
      Returns:
      A default factory loader that load resources using the given class loader and character set.

    • getFactory

      public final Factory getFactory(String name) throws FactoryLoader.TemplateNotFound, Template.Error
      Get a given factory by its name. If the factory has not been created yet, then, if the corresponding source code is found, the factory is automatically created.

      The source code resource resolution depends on factory loader implementation. The default implementation looks for a file with the given name.

      Parameters:
      name - Factory name to get
      Returns:
      Corresponding factory or null if no factory with given name exists.
      Throws:
      FactoryLoader.TemplateNotFound - If template could not be located.
      Template.Error - If template definition contain errors.

    • create

      public Factory create(String name, String src)
      Creates a new template factory.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the factory to be created.
      src - Source code of the templates created by the factory.
      Returns:
      A factory able to create templates with the given source code.

    • create

      public Factory create(String name, char[] src)
      Creates a new template factory.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the factory to be created.
      src - Source code of the templates created by the factory.
      Returns:
      A factory able to create templates with the given source code.

    • loadSourceCode

      protected char[] loadSourceCode(String name) throws FactoryLoader.TemplateNotFound
      Gets source code from a resource name.
      Parameters:
      name - Factory name.
      Returns:
      Source code for the factory with the given name.
      Throws:
      FactoryLoader.TemplateNotFound - When corresponding source code cannot be found.

      Helper function used to read factory definition from a file.
      Parameters:
      f - File where to read the definition
      Returns:
      corresponding source code
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file cannot be read.
